text: Number 64, Mills and others against the Electric Auto-Lite Company.
Mr. Chief Justice --
Mr. Shure?
-- and may it please the Court.
I perhaps have missed the point in this case.
The complaint --
Am I mistaken about that?
That is not pending before the Court Your Honor at this time.
Yeah.
The attack that the trial here, the manner -- the resolution of the case below that brought the case here did not involve the question of fairness at all.
That's what I thought and --
That's right.
Do you think it's irrelevant whether or not these misrepresentations or these omissions affected any votes?
I believe that it is irrelevant because Congress in passing its statute did not inject any element of reliance.
Do you rely on Borak?
I certainly do.
Well, didn't Borak say cause or connection will be tried out in the District Court?
Borak does not say that that cause or relationship must be tried.
Yeah.
In Borak, the case came to this Court on the pleadings and it was not after a resolution.
And what did Borak say?
Borak said that cause or relationship is a matter for the trial court.
You speak of remedy.
As far as remedy is concerned, the --
But do you want damages?
We have the alternative.
Do you want your old pieces of paper?
No --
Rather than the money that you can get out of your new -- that one?
No Your Honor, I don't want the old pieces of paper.
Well don't you get right to the fairness of the merger then?
No.That has nothing to do with fairness Your Honor because --
Well, I would say it would if your stock is worth more than now than it would've been if the merger hadn't taken place, what about your restitutionary --
No one can speculate what the stock would be worth.
You have about seven minutes -- about seven minutes remaining.
Mr. Chief Justice, members of the Court.
That is one to one?
1.88 of the shares of the surviving of the surviving corporation for each share of electro Auto-Lite.
So for every dollar that a man in stocks would worth at Electric Auto-Lite, what's that dollar worth?
As I guess with today's market, $2.00.
Mr. Jenner, haven't both Courts have found the material omission here or --
Would you forgive Your Honor and repeat that?
Haven't both Courts have found the material omission here?
No.
Is that a question of fact or what?

We think it's a question of fact and we believe because the Trial Court followed so called summary judgment procedure that we have never received a full trial on the issue or whether this difference and emphasis was in fact a material omission.
Well that question isn't here.
No, we didn't cross petition if Your Honor please and we do think it's here.
Arguments are usually limited to questions raised in the cert petition aren't they Mr. Jenner?
Well yes they are and they certainly should be.
Well, are you arguing something not in a question decision?
I think not if Your Honor pleases.
Mr. Chief Justice and Your Honors, the fairness as a matter of a fair ratio of exchange in the merger is not here.
